sources.title: 1951 - Ace in the Hole - El gran carnaval - Billy Wilder - VOSE
Ace in the Hole (1951) Director: Billy Wilder, Featuring Kirk Douglas, Jan Sterling, Robert Arthur, Porter Hall, Richard Benedict
sources.description: Ace in the Hole, also known as The Big Carnival, is a 1951 American Film Noir directed by Billy Wilder and starring Kirk Douglas as a cynical, disgraced reporter who stops at nothing to try to regain a job on a major newspaper. The film co-stars Jan Sterling and features Robert Arthur, Richard Benedict and Porter Hall. The story is a biting examination of the seedy relationship between the press, the news it reports and the manner in which it reports it. The film also shows how a gullible public can be manipulated by the press.  In 2017, the film was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". These Wikipedia and Film Nolr of the Week articles provide more information about this movie.

sources.title: A Montanha dos Sete Abutres ("Ace In The Hole", 1951)
sources.description: Direção de Billy Wilder. Com Kirk Douglas, Jan Sterling, Robert Arthur, Porter Hall. Filme com legendas em português.

metadata.Plot: Charles Tatum, a down-on-his-luck reporter, takes a job with a small New Mexico newspaper. The job is pretty boring until he finds a man trapped in an old Indian dwelling. He jumps at the chance to make a name for himself by taking over and prolonging the rescue effort, and feeding stories to major newspapers. He creates a national media sensation and milks it for all it is worth - until things go terribly wrong.
metadata.Writer: Billy Wilder, Lesser Samuels, Walter Newman
metadata.Actors: Kirk Douglas, Jan Sterling, Robert Arthur
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 5 wins & 3 nominations total
